title: Drawing, "Project for the Decoration of an Oblong Panel", ca. 1780
medium: Brush and watercolor over graphite on  white laid paper
creditline: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
description: Two rinceaux are connected by two snakes and a leaf.  The latter forms, together with a calix, the support of a round table top, upon which a bowl stands on three tall legs.  Smoke emerges from the bowl. Two cornucopias are placed in the ring connecting the legs. Stems in heart form spring from them. Above, two birds sit upon festoons.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Project for the Decoration of an Oblong Panel", ca. 1780.
ca. 1780. Brush and watercolor over graphite on  white laid paper. Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt. 1931-64-256.
